intro: Leucopoa carpatica, commonly known as the Carpathian leucopoa, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains in Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its flowers are usually pale green to blue-green in color, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer. Leucopoa carpatica is considered a rare and endemic species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
